reviewText: The United Artists Super Deluxe Gift Set gives you 90 films on 110 discs at under six dollars a disc. This smaller set gives you 30 films on 46 discs at under five dollars a disc. The advantages of this set over the Super Deluxe Gift Set are lower price per disc, a higher percentage of films are classic movies, there are fewer "turkey" movies in this set, and if you are more of a lover of older films there are less modern ones in this set.The major disadvantage is that you are giving up some of the great classics that are in the Super Deluxe Gift Set. Specifically The Woman in the Window, Red River, The Barefoot Contessa, The Night of the Hunter, The Killing, Witness for the Prosecution,  The Defiant Ones, I Want to Live, Inherit the Wind, Elmer Gantry, The Miracle Worker, and In the Heat of the Night are the best of the older classic films that are in the Super Deluxe collection and are not in this one. If you like the more modern films, you are being deprived of those almost entirely by buying this set.Both sets are giving you the best versions they have available - widescreen and/or double disc editions if they are available. The only noteable exception I could find was perhaps "Annie Hall", which the product description says is in pan and scan format versus widescreen. Also note that single disc editions of United Artist films hardly ever have any extras at all - commentary tracks are almost unheard of.
summary: A hard choice between this and the Super Deluxe Giftset
Title: N/A

reviewText: Most of the films in this set are classics, with the main exceptions being Birdcage, Hotel Rwanda and Bowling for Columbine.  Only a few of the films in the set are constantly cited as top notch; Annie Hall, Raging Bull, 12 Angry Men and Some Like It Hot.  However if you look at AFIs list of 400 nominated films you will see most of the films included in the set are on the nomination list.  Judgement and Nuremberg, Marty, The Manchurian Candidate, The Birdman of Alcatraz and Fiddler on the Roof are all excellent films.The main problem is the packaging.  The discs are put into slots on each page describing the film.  However the discs easily slide out of these slots and can get damaged.  If you do purchase this set I recommend you cheap disc cases.At the end of the day the the low price of this set make it more than worth while.  30 films for a little over 100 bucks, AMAZING
Title: N/A

reviewText: Look, if you love movies and movie classics go bananas. But if you buy the box sets for both great films AND the cool box set with it, forget it. When I received this product the box set itself was a little weak. Also, some of the discs were not properly inserted into the holding slots and had been thrown around inside the box. And to make matters worse the binding that holds the pages together was not connected and not I must put the first 4-5 pages in manually before closing the disc booklet. So if you want to buy this, knock yourself out but don't expect professional packaging.
summary: Love the Flicks, Hate the Package

reviewText: Great selection of movies ..nice write-ups for each one .  Good packaging and makes a fab gift or a neat way to have alot of movies in a small space...Just one stinker in the bunch...Bowling for Columbine..don t know what that nutcase's movie is doing in with these classics??!! Geez
